alert.note: Alert for Klamath Basin; Northern and Eastern Klamath County and Western Lake County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 20 at 1:21PM PST until December 21 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Freezing rain could result a thin layer of ice. * WHERE...Northern portions of the Klamath Basin, including Hwy 97 from Chiloquin to Chemult. * WHEN...Until 4 AM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Ice will create slippery and hazardous road conditions, which may impact the morning commute. This could also create a slip hazard on walkways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Any ice accumulation is expected to be minimal. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.

area.areaDesc: Klamath Basin; Northern and Eastern Klamath County and Western Lake County
